introBanner.title: Quantum Computing
introBanner.description: Quantum computing uses quantum mechanics properties like superposition and entanglement to solve complex problems that are impossible for classical computers.

about.title: About Quantum Computing
about.description: Quantum Tic-Tac-Toe demonstrates key quantum mechanics concepts through gameplay:
about.superpositionDesc: A quantum move exists in two squares simultaneously until measured
about.entanglementDesc: When moves share squares, they become quantum-correlated
about.collapseDesc: Quantum states resolve to classical positions when cycles form

howToPlay.title: How to Play
howToPlay.step1: Click two squares for each move - your mark will exist in both
howToPlay.step2: Quantum marks are shown as small badges (X1, O2, etc.)
howToPlay.step3: When cycles form in the entanglement graph, you'll choose a collapse order
howToPlay.step4: Get 3 classical marks in a row to win

rules.title: Game Rules
rules.rule1: Each move places a quantum mark in two squares
rules.rule2: Cycles in entanglement trigger collapse to classical marks
rules.rule3: Only classical marks count toward winning
rules.rule4: First player to get 3 classical marks in a row wins
